author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Syrian Tourism Ministry inks agreements to boost tourismTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Syrian Tourism Ministry inks agreements to boost tourism
As part of the World Tourism Day activities, organised by the Syrian Tourism Ministry, a total of three agreements were signed between the Tourism Ministry and the Information Ministry, the Export Development and Promotion Agency (EDPA) and Syriatel.
The World Tourism Day was organised by the Tourism Ministry, under the “I belong to Syria, I belong to the future” slogan, which was held at Dar al-Assad for Culture and Arts (Opera House).
The agreement with the Information Ministry seeks to improve to promote tourism elements in Syria and its cultural and human heritage by improving cooperation between the two ministries, the event’s coordinator, Ruba Sasilla, told SANA.
Highlighting on the agreement with the EDPA, she said it seeks to distribute, ship, and export promotional items related to the “I belong” initiative and facilitate tourism promotion activities abroad.
The agreement with Syriatel seeks to launch an application called Mobile Syria, that includes a promotional tourism map for all tourist sites and tourist facilities like restaurants, hotels, theme parks, and various activities in Syria, Sasilla concluded.
